newsitem.title: USA: Software Publishing, Allegro to merge.
newsitem.headline: Software Publishing, Allegro to merge.

text.p: Allegro New Media Inc and Software Publishing Corp said Wednesday they have entered a definitive merger agreement.
Under the deal Software Publishing stockholders will receive about 0.26805 shares of Allegro common stock for each share of Software Publishing stock.
After the merger Software Publishing stockholders and vested option holders will hold 45 percent of the outstanding shares and vested options of Allegro.

Software Publishing will become a subsidiary of Allegro but continue to operate under the Software Publishing name, the companies said. They also said key Software Publishing officers will become Allegro officers.
The companies said their boards have unanimously approved the agreement and they are awaiting approval from their stockholders.
The merger would be a tax-free reorganization accounted for under the purchase method, and it should close around December 31, they said.
